dt: {bc}making an angle with a line or plane

shortdef: making an angle with a line or plane

dt: {bc}to bend the head or body forward {bc}{sx|bow||}
{bc}to lean, tend, or become drawn toward an opinion or course of conduct
{bc}to deviate from a line, direction, or course
{bc}to deviate from the vertical or horizontal

dt.t: his love of books {it}inclined{/it} him toward a literary career

dt: {bc}to give a bend or slant to

pt: {sc}incline{/sc} {sc}bias{/sc} {sc}dispose{/sc} {sc}predispose{/sc} mean to influence one to have or take an attitude toward something. {sc}incline{/sc} implies a tendency to favor one of two or more actions or conclusions.
{sc}bias{/sc} suggests a settled and predictable leaning in one direction and connotes unfair prejudice.
{sc}dispose{/sc} suggests an affecting of one's mood or temper so as to incline one toward something.

pt.t: her nature {it}disposes{/it} her to trust others

pt: {sc}predispose{/sc} implies the operation of a disposing influence well in advance of the opportunity to manifest itself.

pt.t: does fictional violence {it}predispose{/it} them to accept real violence?

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}incliner, encliner{/it}, from Latin {it}inclinare{/it}, from {it}in-{/it} + {it}clinare{/it} to lean {ma}{mat|lean|}{/ma}
shortdef: to bend the head or body forward : bow
to lean, tend, or become drawn toward an opinion or course of conduct
to deviate from a line, direction, or course; specifically : to deviate from the vertical or horizontal

dt: {bc}a plane surface that makes an oblique angle with the plane of the horizon

shortdef: a plane surface that makes an oblique angle with the plane of the horizon

dt: {bc}wanting to do something or likely to do something

dt.t: Feel free to leave early if you're {it}so inclined{/it}.

shortdef: wanting to do something or likely to do something
